sources.title: The Canary Murder Case
sources.description: Title: The Canary Murder Case Summary: A beautiful showgirl, nicknamed 'the Canary', is a scheming nightclub singer. Blackmailing is her game and soon ends up dead. But who killed 'the Canary'. All the suspects who knew her had ... Directed by: Malcolm St. Clair, Frank Tuttle Actors: Production Company: Paramount Pictures Release Date: 1929 (Germany) Aspect Ratio: 1.20 : 1 A beautiful showgirl, nicknamed 'the Canary', is a scheming nightclub singer. Blackmailing is her game and soon ends up dead. But who killed 'the Canary'. All the suspects who knew her had been used by her. The only witness to the crime was also killed. Only one man, debonair detective, Philo Vance, might be able to figure out who silenced 'the Canary'.

sources.title: The Canary Murder Case (1929) WILLIAM POWELLüçï LOUISE BROOKS
sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: William Powell, Louise Brooks, Jean Arthur
Director: Malcolm St. Clair
This classic WHODUNIT marks the cinematic birth of super sleuth Philo Vance! Slipping into the shoes of the debonair detective is WILLIAM POWELL, while silent screen siren LOUISE BROOKS sets the deadly plot in motion as a scheming showgirl with one too many secrets.

Directed by Malcolm St. Clair and co-starring future star Jean Arthur, The Canary Murder Case delivers suspense, style, and sharp dialogue straight from the heart of pre-Code Hollywood. This early talkie blends mystery and intrigue with the charisma of cinema‚Äôs finest classic stars.

üçïTRIVIAüçïThis is the film that got Louise Brooks "cancelled" in Hollywood. Initially produced as a silent, after production wrapped, Paramount decided to convert it into a "talkie." However, Brooks had completed her contract for Paramount and declined to renew it after the studio refused her request for a raise. When she refused to record her dialogue, actress Margaret Livingston was hired for the overdubs.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

This vintage gem is a must-see whether you're a fan of William Powell‚Äôs Philo Vance, Louise Brooks‚Äô unforgettable screen presence, or classic detective films. Don‚Äôt forget to like, comment, and subscribe to PizzaFLIX for more timeless mysteries and old Hollywood treasures!

sources.title: The Canary Murder Case (1929)
sources.description: The Canary Murder Case is a 1929 American pre-Code crime-mystery film based on the 1927 novel of the same name by S. S. Van Dine. It follows detective Philo Vance as he investigates the murder of a nightclub singer known as "The Canary," who was involved in blackmailing several men. As Vance delves into the case, he uncovers a web of deceit and motives among the suspects, ultimately revealing the true killer through clever deduction.

metadata.Plot: A beautiful showgirl, nicknamed 'the Canary', is a scheming nightclub singer. Blackmailing is her game and soon ends up dead. But who killed 'the Canary'. All the suspects who knew her had been used by her. The only witness to the crime was also killed. Only one man, debonair detective, Philo Vance, might be able to figure out who silenced 'the Canary'.
metadata.Writer: S.S. Van Dine, Florence Ryerson, Albert S. Le Vino
metadata.Actors: William Powell, Jean Arthur, James Hall
